metadata.title: CVE-2018-1000222 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Libgd version 2.2.5 contains a Double Free Vulnerability vulnerability ingdImageBmpPtr Function that can result in Remote Code Execution . Thisattack appear to be exploitable via Specially Crafted Jpeg Image cantrigger double free. This vulnerability appears to have been fixed in aftercommit ac16bdf2d41724b5a65255d4c28fb0ec46bc42f5.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1000222` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libgd-tools - 2.1.1-4ubuntu0.16.04.10
libgd3 - 2.1.1-4ubuntu0.16.04.10
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libgd2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.1-4ubuntu0.16.04.10').
